title: Representations - Connect f-f prime-f double prime

content.question: The figure above shows the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, a, comma b, close bracket " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following could be the graph of <math alttext="f prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>â€²</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, the derivative of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, a, comma b, close bracket " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane. The letter a, is indicated on the x axis, just to the left of the origin. The letter b is indicated on the x axis, far to the right of the origin. The curve begins below the x axis, where x equals a. It moves briefly downward and to the right then levels off and reaches a minimum below the x axis, and to the left of the y axis. It then moves upward and to the right, crossing the y axis just below the origin, and crossing the x axis just to the right of the origin. It continues upward until it levels off and reaches a local maximum just above the x axis. The curve then moves downward and to the right, crossing the x axis about halfway along the axis, until it levels off and reaches a local minimum just below the x axis. It then moves steeply upward and to the right, crossing the x axis about three fourths of the way along the axis, and continues upward until it ends high above the x axis, just to the left of where x equals b.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane. The letter a, is indicated on the x axis, just to the left of the origin. The letter b is indicated on the x axis, far to the right of the origin. The curve begins just above the x axis, where x equals a. It moves steeply upward and to the right then levels off and reaches a maximum high above the x axis, and to the left of the y axis. It then moves downward and to the right, steeply at first, before moving more steadily downward. It crosses the y axis just above the origin, and crosses the x axis just to the right of the origin. It continues downward until it levels off and reaches a local minimum below the x axis. The curve then moves upward and to the right, crossing the x axis, until it levels off and reaches a local maximum above the x axis, about halfway along the axis. It then moves steeply downward and to the right, crossing the x axis, until it levels off far below the x axis and reaches a local minimum below the x axis. It then moves upward and to the right until ends below the x axis, where x equals b.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane. The letter a, is indicated on the x axis, just to the left of the origin. The letter b is indicated on the x axis, far to the right of the origin. The curve begins high above the x axis, where x equals a. It moves downward and to the right, crossing the y axis just above the origin, and crossing the x axis just to the right of the origin. It continues downward until it levels off and reaches a local minimum just below the x axis. The curve then moves upward and to the right, crossing the x axis, until it levels off and reaches a local maximum just above the x axis, about halfway along the axis. It then moves downward and to the right, crossing the x axis, until it ends far below the x axis, where x equals b.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane. The letter a, is indicated on the x axis, just to the left of the origin. The letter b is indicated on the x axis, far to the right of the origin. The curve begins just above the x axis, where x equals a. It moves steeply upward and to the right then levels off and reaches a maximum high above the x axis, and to the left of the y axis. It then moves downward and to the right, crossing the y axis above the origin, and crossing the x axis just to the right of the origin. It continues downward until it levels off and reaches a local minimum below the x axis. The curve then moves upward and to the right until it levels off and reaches a local maximum just below the x axis, about halfway along the axis. It then moves downward and to the right until it levels off and reaches a local minimum below the x axis. It then moves upward and to the right, crossing the x axis just to the left of b, and ends just above the x axis, where x equals b.

content.answer: The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane. The letter a, is indicated on the x axis, just to the left of the origin. The letter b is indicated on the x axis, far to the right of the origin. The curve begins just above the x axis, where x equals a. It moves steeply upward and to the right then levels off and reaches a maximum high above the x axis, and to the left of the y axis. It then moves downward and to the right, steeply at first, before moving more steadily downward. It crosses the y axis just above the origin, and crosses the x axis just to the right of the origin. It continues downward until it levels off and reaches a local minimum below the x axis. The curve then moves upward and to the right, crossing the x axis, until it levels off and reaches a local maximum above the x axis, about halfway along the axis. It then moves steeply downward and to the right, crossing the x axis, until it levels off far below the x axis and reaches a local minimum below the x axis. It then moves upward and to the right until ends below the x axis, where x equals b.

topic.text: 5.9: Connecting a Function, Its First Derivative, and Its Second Derivative

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
